alert.note: Alert for Natchitoches (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 12:44AM CST until January 26 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in north central Louisiana, Grant and Winn. In northwest Louisiana, Natchitoches and Sabine. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1244 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winnfield, Colfax, Montgomery, Goldonna, Dodson, Calvin, Atlanta, Sikes, St. Maurice, Aloha, Lake Iatt, Bermuda, Melrose, Williana, Cloutierville, Joyce, Chopin, Cypress, Hudson and Gorum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
